properties.Name: Lupote Clinic
properties.Activity: Sabona contracted a doctor to deliver essential medication to the community, significantly easing the supply shortages faced by local clinics. This initiative has particularly helped the elderly, who no longer need to travel long distances for medical care. By offering on-site medical support and medications, Sabona has improved healthcare accessibility for vulnerable populations, enhancing their overall health and well-being.

properties.Name: Mpilo Hospital
properties.Activity: Sabona introduced a leap learning program in the pediatric ward, giving hospitalized children access to educational tablets. This initiative provides fun, interactive learning materials, helping them stay engaged and not fall behind in their education. By blending education with entertainment, the program enhances the children’s well-being and makes their hospital stay more enjoyable.

properties.Name: Fatima Clinic
properties.Activity: The Sabona Trust's mother's shelter has greatly benefited rural communities by providing pregnant women living far from clinics with a safe place to stay as they approach labor. This initiative has significantly reduced unsafe home births, ensuring that mothers have immediate access to medical care when needed. By fostering a supportive environment, the shelter not only enhances maternal and infant health outcomes but also encourages more women to seek professional assistance during childbirth, ultimately improving the overall well-being of the community.
